sen.j: 山辺安摩呂（やまへのやすまろ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: YAMAHE no Yasumaro (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
YAMAHE no Yasumaro (date of birth and death unknown) lived during Japan's Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: YAMAHE no Yasumaro (date of birth and death unknown) lived during Japan's Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「やまへのやすまろ」で同じ。
sen.e: His name is also pronounced "YAMAHE no Yasumaro" in old Japanese syllabary characters.
In the old Japanese kana syllabary, too, his name is pronounced "YAMAHE no Yasumaro."
sen.cmt: 「同じ」の意をわかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese kana syllabary, too, his name is pronounced "YAMAHE no Yasumaro."
His hereditary title was Kimi (one of the lower title under Yamato dynasty).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）側につき、都を脱出した大津皇子に同行した。
sen.e: He followed Prince Oama in the Jinshin War in 672 and accompanied Prince Otsu who escaped from the capital in the Jinshin War in 672.
He followed Prince Oama in the Jinshin War of 672 and accompanied Prince Otsu in his escape from the capital.
sen.cmt: in the Jinshin War in 672が2度出てくるのでひとつを削除しました。
sen.e: He followed Prince Oama in the Jinshin War of 672 and accompanied Prince Otsu in his escape from the capital.

sen.j: 山辺氏は大和国山辺郡の豪族である。
sen.e: Yamahe clan was a local ruling family in Yamabe county, Yamato Province.
Yamahe clan was a local ruling family in Yamabe county, Yamato Province.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の勃発時、安摩呂は近江宮がある大津市にいたとされる。
sen.e: It is supposed that Yasumaro was in Otsu City where Omi no miya was located when the Jinshin War started,
It is believed that Yasumaro was in Otsu where Omi no miya was located when the Jinshin War started.
sen.cmt: リンク表記で「大津市」となっていますが当時は「大津」なので（web表記も「大津」）、Cityは削除しました。
sen.e: It is believed that Yasumaro was in Otsu where Omi no miya was located when the Jinshin War started.

sen.j: 大海人皇子が挙兵を決めたとき、その子高市皇子と大津皇子は敵の本拠である大津を脱し、二手に分かれて父のあとを追った。
sen.e: When Prince Oama decided to raise an army, his children, Prince Takechi and Otsu, escaped from Otsu where enemy's headquarters were located and ran after their father splitting in two groups.
When Prince Oama raised his army, his children, Princes Takechi and Otsu, escaped from Otsu where the enemy's headquarters was located and ran after their father separately in two groups.
sen.cmt: Prince を複数にしました。
sen.e: When Prince Oama raised his army, his children, Princes Takechi and Otsu, escaped from Otsu where the enemy's headquarters was located and ran after their father separately in two groups.

sen.j: このうち大津皇子の一行は25日深夜に伊勢国の鈴鹿関に到達し、翌朝朝明郡の迹太川の辺で合流を果たした。
sen.e: The Otsu prince's party arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in at midnight of 25th and joined the father's party next morning around Toho-gawa River.
Prince Otsu's party arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in Ise Province at midnight of 25th and joined his father's party next morning at the bank of Toho-gawa River in Asake-no-kori county.
sen.cmt: The Otsu princeをPrince Otsuに訂正し、「朝明郡」を追加しました。
sen.e: Prince Otsu's party arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in Ise Province at midnight of 25th and joined his father's party next morning at the bank of Toho-gawa River in Asake-no-kori county.

sen.j: 山辺安摩呂はこの一行の中にいた。
sen.e: YAMAHE no Yasumaro was in this party.
YAMAHE no Yasumaro was in this party.

sen.j: ともに朝明郡にたどりついたのは、大分恵尺、難波三綱、駒田忍人、小墾田猪手、埿部視枳、大分稚臣、根金身、漆部友背であった。
sen.e: The followers who got to Asake-no-kori county were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, NE no Kanemi and NURIBE no Tomose.

sen.j: この後の内戦で山辺安摩呂が果たした活動については記録がない。
sen.e: No records of YAMAHE no Yasumaro's activities in the later domestic warfare were kept.
